summary: This document is an email chain from May 2020 discussing a news article about Jeffrey Epstein's lawyer, Mark S. Schoen. The correspondents express disbelief at Schoen's claims about replacing Epstein's defense team and his alleged strategy. The emails also reference a delayed legal hearing involving 'Mazer'.

persons.name: Dominic Gentile
persons.context: Email recipient mentioned in the chain; appears to be a federal prosecutor in the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Jay Lefkowitz
persons.context: Referenced as a 'numbskull' by Mark S. Schoen in a quoted statement, suggesting he was part of Epstein's defense team.

persons.name: Mark S. Schoen
persons.context: Subject of the discussed news article; claimed Epstein asked him to replace the entire defense team and that he had a strategy for smearing victims, which the email authors find false and insane.

persons.name: Mazer
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to a delayed 2255 hearing that was over a year old at the time of the email.

connections.description: Schoen reportedly criticized Lefkowitz, calling him a 'numbskull', indicating a contentious professional relationship within Epstein's legal defense.
Schoen is identified as Epstein's lawyer, and the article claims Epstein asked Schoen to take over his entire case.

events.title: Email Discussion on Epstein Article
events.description: Email chain circulates and discusses a Daily Mail article about Epstein's lawyer Mark S. Schoen making controversial claims.

events.title: NYT Article on Late Judicial Decisions
events.description: A New York Times article from 2004 about judges' decisions being conspicuously late is referenced in the email chain.

events.title: 2255 Hearing
events.description: A 2255 hearing (likely a motion to vacate, set aside, or correct sentence) involving 'Mazer' was held, and by May 2020, a decision was over a year late.

keyFacts: An email chain discusses a Daily Mail article where Epstein's lawyer, Mark S. Schoen, claimed Epstein asked him to replace his entire defense team.
The email authors strongly dispute Schoen's claims, calling them 'totally false' and 'completely insane', and question why he would brag about a strategy to smear victims.
The emails reference a significantly delayed legal decision (over a year) regarding a 2255 hearing for an individual named 'Mazer'.
Jay Lefkowitz, a lawyer on Epstein's team, is disparagingly called a 'numbskull' by Schoen in the reported claims.
